resources.string: Watch your call, message and data plans!
CallMeter generates reports from call, message and data logs. It supports several modes of billing.
The output format is usage | time or count used this billing period | time or count overall.
The billing mode specifies the length of the first / next billing intervals. E.g. 60/10 means every call is billed for minimum 60s, any longer call is rounded up to next full 10s.

CallMeter runs in background every 30min (only if not in standby). This means, that deleting calls or messages older than 30min will not change your stats. Deleting calls or messages younger than 30min may result in wrong statistics.
Shorter period will use more battery.
Ignore any logs before this date.
Some tips and tricks, how to set up this app.
Follow me on twitter.\nGet update notifications etc.
This allows you to set a way more complex setup. Most Users won\'t need it.
Text size in pixels; leave empty for default
Show title bar in main view. Without title bar, there is no way to see background activity.
Show time in seconds, minutes, hours and days.\nIf unchecked only seconds and hours are shown.
Set a custom currency symbol, leave empty for system default.
Set your plans for all kind of billing here.

Add some numbers this rule must match.

Wildcards ("%") are allowed on both ends of the number.
E.g. %34 will match 1234, 12% will match 1234 and %23% will match 12345.
Add some numbers this rule must not match.\nSee above.
Add some hours this rule must match.
Add some hours this rule must not match.
Resetting call/sms data will result in recalculation of the statistics.\n\nResetting traffic statistics is permanent. It only resets traffic done before boot!
Recalculating statistics ...\n\n(This may take some time!)
Set a short name here. It is displayed in compact layouts.

Select a type.
"Title" will just display a title in main view.
"Spacer" will display nothing but empty space.
"Bill period" will hold any information about your billing period. Most users will need exactly one.
A "mixed" plan can take calls and messages at once. It will combine billing of all those items.
A "call" plan does only take calls. "SMS" and "MMS" plans will just take the messages.
A "data" plan may hold information about your data traffic.

Set the type of your limit here.\nA \"units\" limit will limit your plan based on minutes, messages, ...\nA \"cost\" limit will limit your plan based on cost produced by the items billed in this plan.

Set the limit of your plan here.

Type "units" must be set in minutes (calls), messages (sms/mms), megabytes (data, 1024kB) or units (mixed).

Type "cost" must be set in your main currency (e.g. $).

Set the mode of billing calls.
The first part is the minimum length billed by your provider. Each call with a shorter length is rounded up to this.
The second part is the minimum length of following blocks of seconds.
Please read the FAQ for further help.
First day of the billing period
Set this to the first day of the bill of the current billing period.
Select your billing period.\nYou may need to create one as extra plan.
Set the length of your billing period.
Set the cost billed for a single log item (e.g. a call or a message) after the limit is exceeded.
Set the cost billed for a single log item (e.g. a call or a message) billed before the limit is exceeded.
Set the cost billed per length for a single log item (e.g. for 1kB data) after the limit is exceeded.

Set the cost billed per length for a single log item (e.g. for 1min call) after the limit is exceeded.\nThe first field holds the cost for the first few seconds of the call, the second holds the cost for the following seconds (both are set in $/minute; see billing mode).\nIf doubt, just set both to your cost minute.
Set the cost billed per length for a single log item (e.g. for 1kB data) before the limit is exceeded.

Set the cost billed per length for a single log item (e.g. for 1min call, 1kB data) before the limit is exceeded.\nThe first field holds the cost for the first few seconds of the call, the second holds the cost for the following seconds (both are set in $/minute; see billing mode).\nIf doubt, just set both to your cost minute.
Set the cost of the plan for one billing period as is.
Set the units billed for a single sms.
Set the units billed for a single mms.
Set the units billed for a one minute call.\nBill mode is taken into account here.
Choose the plan this rule should fit.
Match only if target plan has not reached it\'s limit yet.
Choose a direction the given log has to be.
Choose whether the given log has to be roamed.
No plans/rules set. Click this text to import a default rule set.\n\nOr add plans and rules in preferences manually.
Set alerts based on plan usage.
Notify if a plan passes 80% of it\'s limit.
Notify if a plan passes 100% of it\'s limit.
